edu.umaryland.igs.idea
Class FileParameter

java.lang.Object
  edu.umaryland.igs.idea.Parameter
      edu.umaryland.igs.idea.FileParameter
All Implemented Interfaces:
Serializable
Direct Known Subclasses:
StandardFileParameter
public class FileParameter
extends Parameter

FileParameter represents a user-specifiable filename parameter which determines IDEA behavior. This class overrides Parameter to provide an entry area which includes a "Browse" button that brings up a file chooser.

Written:

Copyright (C) 2006, Amy Egan and Joana C. Silva.

All rights reserved.

Author:
Amy Egan

Constructor Detail

FileParameter

public FileParameter(String n,
                     Object v,
                     ParameterExplanation e)
This is the basic constructor for FileParameter. It calls the superclass constructor, which creates the text field and its listeners.

Parameters:
n - the parameter name
v - the parameter value
e - the parameter explanation

FileParameter

public FileParameter(String n,
                     Object v,
                     String e)

Parameters:
n - the parameter name
v - the parameter value
e - a String containing the text of the one-line parameter explanation

setEnabled

public void setEnabled(boolean enabled)
The setEnabled overrides the method in class Parameter to disable the Browse button.

Overrides:
setEnabled in class Parameter
Parameters:
enabled - whether the parameter should be enabled

setBrowseButtonListener

protected void setBrowseButtonListener(ActionListener al)
The setBrowseButtonListener method adds the specified listener to the Browse button and removes any previous listener. This is necessary to prevent duplicate listeners when the user displays a GUI page more than once.

Parameters:
al - the new ActionListener for the Browse button

entryArea

public JPanel entryArea(int minimumNameLength)
The entryArea method returns a GUI component that displays the name of the parameter and, if available, an explanation of its interpretation and allows the user to enter a value. This overrides the superclass method to provide a "Browse" button that brings up a file chooser. Callers of this method supply a minimumNameLength parameter obtained from a ParameterSet containing this parameter.

Overrides:
entryArea in class Parameter
Parameters:
minimumNameLength - the text label length, based on the maximum length among names in the parameter set
Returns:
a JPanel component to add to the GUI

readObject

private void readObject(ObjectInputStream in)
                 throws IOException,
                        ClassNotFoundException
The readObject method has the exact signature required for Java serialization, although serialization is actually performed using the third-party XStream library. Parameters require custom serialization because the action and focus listeners which update their values based on user input to the GUI are not fields of the objects they listen on and thus are not automatically restored during deserialization, so they must be restored explicitly to ensure that parameter changes the user makes after loading a saved configuration are honored. Since the addActionListener method modifies the actionListeners field, a copy must be used here to avoid a ConcurrentModificationException. After adding the listeners to the GUI components using addActionListener, the actionListeners parameter is reset to the copy so it will not contain duplicates. NOTE: This method is identical for class Parameter and all its subclasses, but because it is required to be private, it has been copied into each subclass.

Parameters:
in - the input stream from which to read this parameter
Throws:
IOException - if an I/O error occurs during deserialization
ClassNotFoundException - if a class in the hierarchy of the deserialized parameter is unrecognized
